meanings.definition: To catch birds by smearing branches with a sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: The old farmer was birdliming to catch some birds for his dinner.
meanings.sent2: The villagers often birdlime to capture colorful birds for their aviary.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried birdliming the tree to catch the chirping sparrows.
meanings.sent4: The sticky trap of birdliming on the branches was a cunning way to lure unsuspecting birds.
meanings.sent5: Birdliming the twigs with glue helped the birdwatcher study the different species up close.

meanings.definition: The act of using birdlime to trap birds.
meanings.sent1: Birdliming can be harmful to bird populations if not regulated.
meanings.sent2: The ancient practice of birdliming has been banned in many countries.
meanings.sent3: The children found an old jar of birdliming in the shed and thought it was a magical potion.
meanings.sent4: The market sold various types of birdliming for different bird species.
meanings.sent5: The conservationist campaigned against the use of birdliming to protect the local birdlife.
